articles.title: Equality before law
articles.description: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.

articles.title: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc.
articles.description: All citizens shall have the right to freedom of speech and expression, to assemble peaceably and without arms, to form associations or unions, to move freely throughout the territory of India, to reside and settle in any part of the territory of India, and to practice any profession, or to carry on any occupation, trade or business.

articles.title: Protection of life and personal liberty
articles.description: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

articles.title: Remedies for enforcement of rights
articles.description: The right to move the Supreme Court by appropriate proceedings for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this Part is guaranteed.

articles.title: Uniform civil code
articles.description: The State shall endeavor to secure for the citizens a uniform civil code throughout the territory of India.

articles.title: Fundamental duties
articles.description: It shall be the duty of every citizen of India to abide by the Constitution and respect its ideals and institutions, the National Flag and the National Anthem.

articles.title: Power of High Courts to issue certain writs
articles.description: Notwithstanding anything in article 32, every High Court shall have power, throughout the territories in relation to which it exercises jurisdiction, to issue to any person or authority, including in appropriate cases any Government, within those territories directions, orders or writs.

articles.title: Persons not to be deprived of property save by authority of law
articles.description: No person shall be deprived of his property save by authority of law.

articles.title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
articles.description: When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all, each of such persons is liable for that act in the same manner as if it were done by him alone.

articles.title: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
articles.description: Whoever is a party to a criminal conspiracy to commit an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment for a term of two years or upwards, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had abetted such offence.

articles.title: Punishment for murder
articles.description: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

articles.title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
articles.description: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

articles.title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
articles.description: Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any property to any person, or to make, alter or destroy the whole or any part of a valuable security, or anything which is signed or sealed, and which is capable of being converted into a valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

articles.title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty
articles.description: Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine.

articles.title: Punishment for rape
articles.description: Whoever, except in the cases provided for in sub-section (2), commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than ten years, but which may extend to imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
